data.title: Fix my headings: #'s to =='s
data.statement:
I wrote some wiki-formatted text and accidentally used #'s as the heading signifier, instead of '=='.

My wiki text should have been written with main headings in <<==Heading Title==>> format, but instead I wrote them as <<#Heading Title>>. Instead of <<===Sub-heading text===>> I would just add incremental extra #'s": <<##Sub-heading text>>, <<###Subsub-heading>>.

(Note: this is converting headings from markdown to wikitext)

If a line of input text has <<a # at the start>>, then print that line replacing the #'s at the start with the corresponding number of ='s on either side (start and end) based on the below conversion table:
<<#Line of text>> ⟶ <<==Line of text==>>
<<##Line of text>> ⟶ <<===Line of text===>>
<<###Line of text>> ⟶ <<====Line of text====>>


Do not change lines of text that do not start with the # character:
<<Line of text>> ⟶ <<Line of text>>

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

I wrote some wiki-formatted text and accidentally used #'s as the heading signifier, instead of '=='.

My wiki text should have been written with main headings in ==Heading Title== format, but instead I wrote them as #Heading Title. Instead of ===Sub-heading text=== I would just add incremental extra #'s": ##Sub-heading text, ###Subsub-heading.

(Note: this is converting headings from markdown to wikitext)

If a line of input text has a # at the start, then print that line replacing the #'s at the start with the corresponding number of ='s on either side (start and end) based on the below conversion table:
#Line of text ⟶ ==Line of text==
##Line of text ⟶ ===Line of text===
###Line of text ⟶ ====Line of text====


Do not change lines of text that do not start with the # character:
Line of text ⟶ Line of text
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of lines of text to fix.
Next N lines: Text with #'s used to signify headings and sub-headings.
Output
N lines: The text, with heading lines fixed such that they are enclosed in '=='s (or '==='s, etc.)
Constraints
There may be #'s or ='s in the text (that should be treated as actual text), but any # at the start of a line is a heading signifier. There will never be more than three #'s at the start of a line.
0 < N < 30
Example
Input
1
#Test heading
Output
==Test heading==
